pomegranate.title: Exhibit home for eastasian very slow to load

comments.body:
I deleted the duplicates of that field for now. I didn't do anything to any other exhibits. Here are the duplicate counts:

```
Spotlight::CustomField.all.select{|v| v.slug.length > 30}.select{|x| x.slug.match(/\d/)}.map(&:exhibit_id).group_by{|i| i}.map{|k,v| [Spotlight::Exhibit.find(k).slug, v.count]}
=> [["cotsen", 615], ["hellenica", 194], ["music", 494], ["eastasian", 97], ["lapidus", 315], ["pudl0135", 256], ["scheide", 206], ["neareast", 92], ["pudl0058", 38], ["papyri", 337], ["Fragments", 9], ["ealtoc", 1]]
```

We think https://github.com/pulibrary/pomegranate/blob/master/spec/models/iiif_resource_spec.rb#L134-L149 tests the fact that new custom fields aren't created on every index. It must be creating override title custom fields elsewhere? We've also noticed some exhibits have multiple override title custom fields.

There is a valid custom field with a slug longer than 30 characters. When cleaning up do this to ensure we don't delete it mistakenly:

```ruby
Spotlight::CustomField.all.select{|v| v.slug.length > 30}.select{|x| x.slug.match(/\d/)}.each do |x|
  x.destroy
end
```

comments.body:
- Nokogiri::XML::RelaxNG has a bug: it interprets `<zeroOrMore>` as "required" (e.g. throws an error when `note` is absent but is specified as zeroOrMore). I noticed this can be fixed by changing schema syntax to `<optional>`.
- NB: error messages are Nokogiri::XML::SyntaxError objects
- Doesn't interpret embedded schematron rules
- runs much slower than in oxygen

oxygen/jing:
`element "descgrp" incomplete; missing required element "processinfo"`

versus 

nokogiri:
```
152:0: ERROR: Expecting an element note, got nothing

152:0: ERROR: Expecting an element processinfo, got nothing

152:0: ERROR: Invalid sequence in interleave

152:0: ERROR: Element descgrp failed to validate content
```

(NB the latter two errors are somewhat redundant, since the missing elements are children of descgrp. Interpreting these error messages may take a little getting used to.)
Nokogiri::XML::Schema is an option to validate against an xsd. I'm not sure we'll need it, but it's there.

schematron (https://rubygems.org/gems/schematron)
running into installation issues: `error occurred while installing libxml-ruby (1.1.4), and Bundler cannot continue`

If we can get it (or another) to work, we could rewrite the local schema entirely in schematron if we need the interleave rules that Nokogiri::XML::RelaxNG skips.

requests.title: Re-activate Resource Sharing Features for Charged Items

comments.body:
Currently how it works:
Case 1 - Borrow direct lookup succeeds  The interface allows the direct request for borrow direct.  This is part of the javascript flash message.  The javascript updates the main form to include only the borrow direct. "We have found an item in borrow direct, do you want to request it" (Case 1 will never happen because the API is down).

Case 2 - Borrow Direct Look Up does not succeed.  Allow the user to put in an Iliad loan request. "Illiad Resource sharing system and the staff will be in touch"


How we want it to work:

There will just be a row with a request and a submit. "Request via Borrow Direct or Inter Library Loan"

- First call out to Borrow Direct API (**only barcoded users will work**) (**enumerated items will be skipped**) - If that succeeds respond to the user that they have made the request

   May be possible to call request item to do the search and the same time

- Second call out to Illiad 

    - RequestType - "Loan"? 
    - Send different data from the "Article" request type
    https://lib-illiad.princeton.edu/illiad/illiad.dll?Action=10&Form=21 ( see required parameters)
![Screen Shot 2020-09-14 at 11 51 04 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1599081/93108275-9a1c1580-f680-11ea-861a-57513638a0ef.png)

Response will indicate time frame.  We are assuming the delivery time frames have not changed.

Will we be able to get items to off campus users?
